body.name: The Only One Left: A Novel
body.description: THE INSTANT NEW YORK TIMES BESTSELLER Named a summer book to watch by The Washington Post, Boston Globe, USA Today, Oprah, Paste, Country Living, Good Housekeeping, and Nerd Daily "Propulsive ... a dizzying Gothic whodunit." —New York Times Book Review Bestselling author Riley Sager returns with a Gothic chiller about a young caregiver assigned to work for a woman accused of a Lizzie Borden-like massacre decades earlier. At seventeen, Lenora Hope Hung her sister with a rope Now reduced to a schoolyard chant, the Hope family murders shocked the Maine coast one bloody night in 1929. While most people assume seventeen-year-old Lenora was responsible, the police were never able to prove it. Other than her denial after the killings, she has never spoken publicly about that night, nor has she set foot outside Hope’s End, the cliffside mansion where the massacre occurred. Stabbed her father with a knife Took her mother’s happy life It’s now 1983, and home-health aide Kit McDeere arrives at a decaying Hope’s End to care for Lenora after her previous nurse fled in the middle of the night. In her seventies and confined to a wheelchair, Lenora was rendered mute by a series of strokes and can only communicate with Kit by tapping out sentences on an old typewriter. One night, Lenora uses it to make a tantalizing offer—I want to tell you everything. “It wasn’t me,” Lenora said But she’s the only one not dead As Kit helps Lenora write about the events leading to the Hope family massacre, it becomes clear there’s more to the tale than people know. But when new details about her predecessor’s departure come to light, Kit starts to suspect Lenora might not be telling the complete truth—and that the seemingly harmless woman in her care could be far more dangerous than she first thought. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wow! Kept me guessing and that’s hard to do!
reviews.reviewText: Could not put this book down! I read it within 24 hours and normally I can’t read mystery/suspense/thriller books as the plot takes too long and I usually flip to the end and see what happens…. But not with this book! It kept me guessing the entire time, enough turns that you think you know what happened- but you don’t… not until the very end.The story telling is fantastic and kept me engaged the entire time. Typically I can guess a plot line but I trusted the author to keep my guessing and I’m glad that I did.I read, “The last time I lied” by the author during a winter storm that we were stuck inside and the story telling was the same. Enough to keep me guessing and intrigued. So much so that I bought this book and one more by the author.I loved “The last time I lied” but love this one even more. I have a new favorite author!!You won’t be disappointed!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars What you can’t even imagine…
reviews.reviewText: Picture Jane Eyre and the English moors, but set in Maine in 1929! Three members of an extremely wealthy family are murdered on the cusp stock market crash. This story centers on the murders of three family members in 1929 and then details the next fifty years, into the 1970s. Alternating in time, the story considers what actually happened to each family member/story character. All sorts of theories exist but nothing can anticipate the story’s final outcome 50+ years later. Although there were moments that felt implausible, the story unfolds in a riveting manner and the intricacies of the storyline and characters’ lives make for an incredibly intriguing and engaging story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is the second book I have read by Riley Sager, and he is a phenomenal writer! This book is so suspenseful. As soon as you think you can predict the next move, not so fast. There are plenty of twists but they flow, and they create a great, thrilling read!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This was a well paced exquisite novel. I enjoyed every bit of it and especially the ending. Great character development. Compelling with twists and turns I didn’t see coming.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Not to bring down the five and four star ratings, this just didn't get me excited. Excellently written story, the pace was spot on ,but I just couldn't buy into the characters. I had some trouble with the ending. One bombshell after another seemed like the author was trying to hard with the twist and turns. I will certainly check out other stories by the author.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Twists and turns are implausible but fun
reviews.reviewText: This was a pretty fun book and a great premise for a mystery. The gothic house, long ago murder mystery and spooky characters make it a very compelling read. The protaganist, Kit, is likeable but makes some pretty questionable moves throughout. She assumes that she has solved various facets of the mystery and jumps right in to make accusations or take action then it turns out she's wrong so off she goes in a different direction. I did not see some of the plot twists coming and that made it more fun. However, the coincidences and implausible timing throughout was a bit eye-rolliing and annoying at times. Still, this was a fun, readable book and I will likely read more by the author. I rated this book 4 out of 5 - good, solid, fast read that had it's issues but was still overall fun and enjoyable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Couldnt put it down
reviews.reviewText: Wow...wow what a great book with all its twists and turns. Well written, touching, and a great read. Loved the book so glad I read it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars CRAZY PLOT TWIST
reviews.reviewText: I’m normally very good at predicting the plots of thriller books but this one… I was WAY off and once I picked it up, I just couldn’t put it down. Finished it in 3 days! Highly recommend!
Amazing read!!! So many plot twists!! First 10 chapters a bit dry but after that holy!!! It was like watching a movie. Definitely recommend this read.
Effective thriller with a few too many more twists that it can handle, with great atmosphere and distinctive narrative voice and structure.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I read this in one sitting, literally. I devoured it on a 4 hour flight on the way back from our holiday at the start of October. I’d just finished Home Before Dark, another of Riley’s novels. This one is completely different again to any of his other titles that I’ve read and is a contender to be my favourite.This book is set in a crumbling cliffsidemansion with characters who honestly reminded me a little bit of Cluedo characters! The protagonist is Kit, who’s a caregiver to the infamous owner of Hope’s End Lenora. Lenora is introduced to Kit as mute and paralysed however all at Hope’s End is definitely not as it seems.Throughout the narrative, there are letters written about the murders that took place at Hope’s End which help to set the scene of the past alongside Kit trying to understand just who everyone is in the future.This was so full of twists and turns it was unreal! I had absolutely no inclination that the book was going to end the way it did and I mean this had me on my toes right until the last chapter.
Un thriller plein de suspense. On a envie de savoir et pour ma part je ne m'attendais pas au dénouement.
L’ultimo libro di Riley Sager per me è il migliore da lui scritto. Ti tiene incollato al libro dalla prima all’ultima pagina. Inizi a leggerlo e non riesci piu’ a smettere.Capolavoro.
